arm_group.arm_group_label: ART (Efavirenz, Truvada) for all persons HIV+
arm_group.description: Efavirenz and Truvada will be offered to all persons who otherwise do not meet country guidelines for ART treatment.

brief_summary.textblock:
The SEARCH study will evaluate the health, economic and educational impact of early HIV
      diagnosis and immediate antiretroviral treatment using a streamlined care delivery system in
      rural communities in East Africa.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sustainable East Africa Research in Community Health

detailed_description.textblock:
The SEARCH study is a cluster randomized community trial of 32 communities each with
      approximately 10,000 residents.  Annual community health campaigns will be conducted in all
      study communities and will offer HIV testing and multi-disease prevention and treatment
      services.  The intervention is antiretroviral therapy (ART), independent of CD4 cell count,
      delivered in a streamlined approach for all HIV infected adults and children.  Components of
      streamlined care include ongoing HIV combination prevention strategies including male
      circumcision. Control communities will receive annual testing campaigns and ART will follow
      country guidelines for ART.

      HIV incidence will be measured using an efficient community cohort design (ECCO) comprised
      of three key elements: A) baseline household community level census, B) annual community
      health campaigns (CHC) incorporating HIV testing that use unique identifiers to link
      individuals between successive waves of the intervention, and C) tracking and evaluation of
      individuals who do not participate in annual CHCs.

criteria.textblock:
Community Level Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Non-adjacent geopolitical units in south-western and eastern Uganda and western
             Kenya.

          -  Most recent census population between 9,000 and 11,000 individuals.

          -  Served by an ART providing health center.

          -  Community leader commitment for study participation and implementation.

          -  Accessibility to health center via a maintained transportation route.

          -  Community location with sufficient distance from other potential study communities to
             limit contamination of intervention or control conditions (buffer zone)

        Individual Level Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Residency of individual in community, defined as present in household for at least 6
             months of the calendar year.

        Community Level Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Presence of ongoing community-based ART intervention strategies that provide
             treatment outside of the current in-country treatment guidelines.

          -  An urban setting defined as a city with a population of 100,000 or more inhabitants.

          -  Absence of a health center able to provide ART.

intervention.arm_group_label: ART (Efavirenz, Truvada) for all persons HIV+
intervention.intervention_name: ART access with optimized linkage and retention and streamlined care delivery for all persons with HIV

clinical_study.official_title: Sustainable East Africa Research in Community Health

authority: Uganda: National Council for Science and Technology

primary_outcome.description: To determine the effect of a strategy to start ART in HIV diagnosed persons at any CD4 count with streamlined delivery of HIV care compared to a country based ART guidelines on 5-year cumulative HIV incidence in rural communities with annual HIV testing.

reference.citation: Namusobya J, Semitala FC, Amanyire G, Kabami J, Chamie G, Bogere J, Jain V, Clark TD, Charlebois E, Havlir DV, Kamya M, Geng EH. High Retention in Care Among HIV-Infected Patients Entering Care With CD4 Levels >350 cells/μL Under Routine Program Conditions in Uganda. Clin Infect Dis. 2013 Nov;57(9):1343-1350. Epub 2013 Jul 29.

secondary_outcome.description: To compare time from diagnosis to AIDS between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Time from diagnosis to AIDS

secondary_outcome.description:
Analysis of HIV care cascade:
HIV testing, linkage, retention, re-engagement
Clinic efficiencies
Provider attitude and behavior
Patient social networks
Patient satisfaction
secondary_outcome.measure: HIV care implementation

secondary_outcome.description: To compare proportion of total TB and incident TB cases associated with HIV between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Total TB and incident TB cases

secondary_outcome.description: To compare mortality between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Overall mortality

secondary_outcome.description: To compare number of maternal and child deaths between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal and child mortality

secondary_outcome.description: To compare mother to child HIV transmission between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Mother to child transmission

secondary_outcome.description: To compare population HIV RNA metrics between the 2 study arms. HIV metrics include: % with HIV viral suppression; median population HIV RNA level; % HIV RNA by strata i.e. greater than 100,000 vs. <100,000 copies/ml
secondary_outcome.measure: Population HIV RNA metrics

secondary_outcome.description: To determine the association between population HIV RNA metrics and HIV incidence. HIV metrics include: % with HIV viral suppression; median population HIV RNA level; % HIV RNA by strata i.e. greater than 100,000 vs. <100,000 copies/ml
secondary_outcome.measure: Association between population HIV RNA metrics and HIV incidence

secondary_outcome.description: To compare the prevalence of transmitted HIV drug-resistance mutations between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Transmitted HIV drug-resistance mutations

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate predictors of linkage and retention for hypertension and diabetes care
secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of linkage and retention for hypertension and diabetes

secondary_outcome.description: rate of virologic suppression in high CD4 count individuals (CD4>350)
secondary_outcome.measure: Virologic suppression in high CD4 count individuals

secondary_outcome.description: To compare the five year cumulative incidence of internally derived HIV infections (infections genetically linked to a prior infection among members of the same community) between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Five year cumulative incidence of internally derived HIV infections

secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in average levels of adults' on- and off-farm employment between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Average levels of adults' on- and off-farm employment

secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in average levels of children's on- and off-farm employment (child labor) between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Average levels of children's on- and off-farm employment

secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in average levels of children's time allocation to schooling and household activities between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Average levels of children's time allocation to schooling and household activities

secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in average asset holdings (durable good and livestock) between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Average asset holdings

secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in agricultural output and other economic production, such as fishing, between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Agricultural output and other economic production

secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in average levels of cash and in-kind transfers between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Average levels of cash and in-kind transfers

secondary_outcome.description: To compare costs of programming (campaigns, ART) between the 2 study arms: overall; per person identified, linked to care, and started on ART; and per ART-month, CD4 level recovered, and viral load suppressed.
secondary_outcome.measure: Costs of programming

secondary_outcome.description: To compare disease burden (expressed in disability adjusted life years, DALYs) between the 2 study arms, during and modelled beyond the study period.
secondary_outcome.measure: Disease burden

secondary_outcome.description: To compare the savings from averted disease associated treatment costs between the 2 study arms.
secondary_outcome.measure: Savings from averted disease associated treatment costs

secondary_outcome.description: To compare the occurrence and consequences of false positive HIV diagnosis (new).
secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and consequences of false positive HIV diagnosis

secondary_outcome.description: To calculate the incremental cost-effectiveness of the intervention, as net cost per DALY averted.
secondary_outcome.measure: Cost-effectiveness of the intervention

secondary_outcome.description: To determine the effect of a strategy to start ART in HIV diagnosed persons at any CD4 count with streamlined delivery of HIV care compared to a country based ART guidelines on 3-year cumulative HIV incidence in rural communities with annual HIV testing.
secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative HIV incidence

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)
President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label
